content.title: PRISM (Promoting Innovations in Individuals, Start-ups and MSMEs): Category-1: Proof of Concept/ Prototypes/ Models
content.department: Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, Ministry of Science and Technology
content.details: The scheme 'PRISM (Promoting Innovations in Individuals, Start-ups and MSMEs)' aims to support individual innovators to achieve the agenda of inclusive development. It provides support to institutions or organizations leading to the development of state-of-the-art new technology solutions aimed at helping MSME clusters.
benefits: Project cost up to ₹5,00,000 to help Innovators convert their ideas into demonstrable models/prototypes.
Maximum support under this category is ₹2,00,000 or 90% of the approved project cost, whichever is lower.
eligibility: Any Indian citizen including student innovators can avail support to develop their novel idea into demonstrable models/prototypes.

Proposals should preferably be in focus sectors such as Green Technology, Clean Energy, Industrially utilizable smart materials, Waste to Wealth, Affordable Healthcare, and Water and sewage management.
exclusions: Projects relating to pure software development and those involving pure academic research are not eligible.
Students pursuing long-term research projects like doctoral research projects will not be supported.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Eligible applicants must submit their applications complete in all respects to the nearest TOCIC.
documents_required: Innovation (Brief description of the idea highlighting innovative element)
Documentary Proof of Prior Work (video, photo, press coverage etc)
Residence Certificate issued by a Sub-Divisional Magistrate(SDM)/District Magistrate(DM) or a copy of a ration card
PAN Number and a copy of the latest Income Tax Returns filed
No Objection Certificate from the Head of their institutions

faqs.question: What is the role of PRCs in the PRISM scheme?
faqs.answer: PRCs, consisting of external experts, review project progress and make recommendations regarding project milestones and funding.

faqs.question: Can non-student Indian citizens apply for PRISM support?
faqs.answer: Yes, PRISM encourages any Indian citizen with innovative ideas or inventions to apply for support.

faqs.question: What is the maximum project cost supported by PRISM?
faqs.answer: PRISM supports project costs up to ₹5,00,000, with a maximum of ₹2,00,000 or 90% of the approved project cost, whichever is lower.
